thread.title: RSPCA called out to rescue a plastic horse on the motorway | Metro News
thread.title_full: RSPCA called out to rescue a plastic horse on the motorway | Metro News

author: Ashitha Nagesh For Metro.Co.Uk
title: RSPCA called out to rescue a plastic horse on the motorway | Metro News
text:
Ashitha Nagesh for Metro.co.uk Thursday 23 Feb 2017 1:04 pm Slow clap (Picture: RSPCA) 
Someone called the RSPCA to go out and rescue a plastic horse. 
The horse had been tied to the back of a trailer by its legs, and was being towed some 100 miles from Birmingham to Cambridge on Tuesday, February 14. 
Fortunately it was showing no signs of distress when rescuers arrived, because it wasn’t real. 
RSPCA inspector Richard Lythgoe, whose precious time was wasted chasing a fake horse, said he thought the whole thing sounded odd when they first got the complaints. Richard Lythgoe, who was called out to rescue the fake horse (Picture: RSPCA) 
‘The information that was coming in was mainly from drivers who saw the horse tied up by its legs on top of a trailer,’ he said. 
‘Obviously when driving down the motorway and catching a glimpse of this life-size, lifelike horse being pulled down the motorway, it would have been very worrying. Stonemason makes incredible 19th century discovery after finding secret chamber 
‘So thankfully it was just a fake one. 
‘When I got to the house to look into it all I realised it was a life-size plastic horse! 
‘The couple had driven all the way to Birmingham to collect it, and because it was so big they needed a trailer to get it back to Cambridge.’ 
However, the question remains as to why anyone would want a massive plastic horse. More
